intro: Barathranthus axanthus, commonly known as the yellow-leafed barathranthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Barathranthus axanthus is relatively drought-tolerant once established, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid climates.
